meanings.definition: Situated on or above the surface of the ground.
meanings.sent1: The aboveground pool was easy to see from the house.
meanings.sent2: The playground equipment was all aboveground.
meanings.sent3: The aboveground treasure hunt was a hit with the kids.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an aboveground flower blooming in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The aboveground nest of the bird was a masterpiece of engineering.

meanings.definition: Not below the surface of the ground.
meanings.sent1: The aboveground roots of the tree spread far and wide.
meanings.sent2: The aboveground pipes carried water to the surface.
meanings.sent3: The aboveground mole was a terrible digger.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were like aboveground rocks, visible to all.
meanings.sent5: The aboveground bunker was not well-hidden from view.

meanings.definition: Not hidden or secret; open and visible.
meanings.sent1: The aboveground parking lot was full of cars.
meanings.sent2: The aboveground wires crisscrossed the sky.
meanings.sent3: The aboveground surprise party was a success.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were aboveground, evident in her expressions.
meanings.sent5: The aboveground billboard caught everyone's attention.
